title: Sticky Beef & Broccoli Noodle Stir-fry
keywords: Sticky beef, Broccoli, Noodle stir-fry, Fusion, Italian-style, Savory, Fried dough

method.step: Peel your garlic and ginger, then slice your red chilli(es) in half lengthways and deseed (scrape the seeds out with a teaspoon)
Chop all of these together as finely as you can
Trim then slice your spring onion(s) finely
Heat a wide large, based pan with a generous drizzle of vegetable oil over a heigh heat
Once hot, add the chopped garlic, ginger & chilli and cook for 1-2 minutes or until fragrant
Once fragrant, add your beef mince and your five-spice mix and cook for 4-5 minutes or until starting to brown, breaking it up with a wooden spoon as you go
While the mince is cooking, combine your corn flour with your cold water in a bowl and give it a good whisk
Add your hoisin sauce, rice vinegar and 2tsp sugar. This is your stir fry sauce
Cut your broccoli into small florets, discard the stem and leaves
Cut your broccoli into small florets, discard the stem and leaves
Add your medium egg noodles and broccoli florets to a pot and cover with boiled water until fully submerged
Bring to the boil and cook over a heigh heat for 5 minutes or until the noodles are cooked and the broccoli is tender
Once done, drain the noodles & broccoli, reserving a cup of the starchy noodle water
Once the beef has started to brown, ad the sticky stir fry sauce to the pan with half the sliced spring onion and cook for 3-4 minutes or until the beef is cooked through
(Add a splash of starchy water if your sauce is looking a little dry)
Serve the sticky beef & broccoli noodle stir fry in a bowl
Garnish with the remaining sliced spring onion and toasted sesame seeds
